title: Tricorder
trek: A handheld sensor/computer used for rapid scanning and analysis. Medical tricorders are tuned for diagnosis and often include a detachable scanner/probe for high‑resolution readings, usable in sickbay or on away missions.
today: Wearable vital-sign monitors (ECG, pulse rate, SpO₂, temperature, respiration) and clinical wearable patches
Point-of-care rapid tests and portable lab devices for key biomarkers
AI-assisted triage and decision-support tools used alongside clinician judgment
dev: Multi-sensor handheld diagnostics combining imaging, vital signs, and chemistry in one device
Better non-invasive continuous monitoring (more biomarkers, fewer false alarms, better artifact handling)
Clinically validated AI that can suggest differential diagnoses and next tests from multimodal data
Lab-on-a-chip systems that run broader panels from tiny samples with faster turnaround
notes: The Qualcomm Tricorder XPRIZE (2015–2017) pushed teams to build portable devices that track vital signs and help diagnose multiple conditions outside a clinic. Today’s “tricorder-like” capability exists as a toolkit of devices (ultrasound + wearables + rapid tests) rather than one all-in-one scanner.
